It's daylight now and the hooligans are not yet in the tavern but Facu expects them to arrive soon. They will, as always, raise hell, knock over tables and chairs, order food and drink, sleep in the common areas, and just generally make a nuisance of themselves. He knows he must get this problem resolved and does not want to lose what little custom he has.

Facu has identified two possible solutions for the problem. The first is to build a wall around the tavern to protect it from the violent hooligans. This will be costly and the process will take a long time. It will also restrict access to the tavern by those looking for a drink, gambling, or other entertainment. The second solution is to hire a bard. This will entertain the hooligans and the customers.
